Caught up in a strange calamitous world, one preceded by a terrible accident in the past, the friends find themselves alone in the forest with their enigmatic passenger and the heart of a perplexing mystery in this gripping, twisting drama.

Name: First Grade - Kelase Aval - کلاس اول
Story Line: 'First Grade' is the story of Javad, an only child who must stay with with his great aunt Zivar for two days while his parents attend a relative's funeral out of town. Alone with only his aunt and his two lovebirds for company, Javad is initially reluctant to stay. But as he starts to bond with his aunt as he heads to and from school each day, he quickly discovers there's more to her than his first impression, and even begins to enjoy her company. A sweet and gentle film about family bonding and the hidden qualities in everyone.

Name: The Mix - ميكس
Story Line: Esteemed film director Khosrow leads his crew in a race to complete post-production on their latest film in time for the end of the Fajr Film Festival. This extraordinary film treats the audience to a behind-the-scenes look at how sound is created for film, often with comedic and even touching results. As we follow Khosrow on his quest, it becomes clear that while he starts to question his own directing abilities, he will stop at nothing to complete his work, even at the cost of his health. This atmospheric film’s documentary-like format and contemplative use of narration immerses us into Khosrow’s world and the fascinating process of Iranian film-making.

Name: Talking With A Shadow - Goftegoo Ba Sayeh - گفتگو با سایه
Story Line: Docudrama about the works of Sadegh Hedayat, acclaimed Iranian writer, poet and intellectual, focusing on the resounding influence of Western culture in his life. As the benevolent shadow of Sadegh walks us through growing up in Tehran, his fascination with movies like 'Nosferatu' and 'Dracula', his later writings and battles with censorship, we are treated to an intimate insight into one of the most prolific literary minds of the twentieth century. Resounding and entrancing.

Name: Nights of Tehran - Shabhaye Tehran - شبهای تهران
Story Line: Best friends Shirin and Mina are sociology students who spend their time analysing crime and violence in Tehran in an attempt to understand the dark side of society. One day Mina goes missing and ends up the fifth victim of an unknown serial killer. Angry and desperate for answers, Shirin begins her own investigation, determined to bring her friend's killer to justice at any cost. But what kind of dangers is this book-smart girl getting herself into? And could it possibly be that the killer she is hunting isn't as far away as she thinks? A tense and compelling mystery that delves into the darkest corners of the human soul.

Name: The Coming Twilight - Aftab Labe Haye Baam - آفتاب لبه های بام
Story Line: In this compelling drama, Fatemeh lives under the same roof as her daughter and mother. Fatemeh hopes to find her daughter a suitor soon, while also considering her own views on marriage. As Fatemeh struggles to keep her car business afloat while caring for her ailing elderly mother, she learns that the three must work together to face obstacles.

Name: City of Women - Shahre Zanan - شهر زنان
Story Line: Centering upon a community of women who have divided themselves from men, 'City Of Women' explores themes of female strength and individual freedom. In an attempt to end the feud between the Keshtgar and Shavan families, Khan Jan decrees that unless the children of the two families marry, the Keshtgars will be forbidden from using the family garden at Ab Ask and the Shavans will retain control of the properties. When the daughter of the Keshtgars, Mahtab, gets accepted into university, she takes it upon herself to fight this ridiculous law and unite the families by other means. Compelling drama from Ataollah Hayati about the complications brought about by the separation of the sexes. Essential viewing.

Name: Daughters of the Sun - Dokhtarane Khorshid - دختران خورشید
Story Line: Born into absolute poverty, a young girl Amangol is forced to shave her head, disguise herself as a boy and go to work as the apprentice of a rug weaver to help pay for her desperately ill mother's medication. As her master's cruel brutality and greed becomes progressively clear, her only comfort comes from the companionship of her co-workers, in particular another girl Belghies. Despite the violent and suspicious behaviour of their employer, a deep friendship blossoms between the two girls in this haunting and visceral tale of tyranny and silver linings.

Name: The Color of Night - Range Shab - رنگ شب
Story Line: Following a car accident, a man takes in the woman he knocked down with his car along with her young son as an act of kindness. Entering his family home and befriending his wife, it seems that preceding events may not have been as accidental as once thought. This tense thriller leads us down a rabbit hole of deceit and obsession.

Name: Big Drum Under Left Foot - Table Bozorg Zire Paye Chap - طبل بزرگ زیر پای چپ
Story Line: Set during the Iran-Iraq War, 'Big Drum Under Left Foot' tells the story of a group of battleworn Iranian soldiers who become trapped in a trench on the frontline. In desperate need of water, and swiftly running out of options, one of them, Mehran, decides to make his way to the only spring in the region, which is dangerously located between the frontlines. Desperate to survive, and with the situation worsened by the war raging all around them, an incidental meeting between the two sides escalates out of control. Actions will be questioned and alliances will fracture in this reflective wartime drama.

Name: This is Not an Accident - In Yek Tasadof Nist - این یک تصادف نیست
Story Line: 'This Is Not an Accident' is a fast-paced film about a man who causes an accident and cowardly flees the crime scene. With guilt slowly engulfing him, he decides to take action. Disguising himself with a surgical mask, he sneaks into the hospital where the victims are being treated. He begins to help the family of the victims.  However, is this real charity or is he simply looking for evidence that could be used against him? This compelling drama looks at the differences between hero and villain.

Name: The Passenger of Ray - Mosafere Rey - مسافر ری
Story Line: This historical drama is set in Baghdad in the third Islamic century. It follows the life of Abdolazim Hassani, one of the great religious teachers of early Islam, on his legendary journey to Rey. Persecuted by the tenth caliph, Abdolazim is advised to flee Baghdad. He sets out on a long and arduous path to seek refuge in Iran with spies of the caliph in hot pursuit.
Actor: Mohsen Ghazi Moradi ( محسن قاضی مرادی )

Name: Follow the Money - Rade Polo Begiro Biya - رد پولو بگیر و بیا
Story Line: In Tehran, a community of beggars, under the control of Parviz (Dariush Asadzadeh), give him their takings in the streets in exchange for protection. His right hand man leads the beggars in the south side of the city in their daily pursuits. As Parviz' niece returns to the city to make a documentary about the beggars, she and her uncle's protege strike up a friendship. A whimsical yet poignant adventure drama.

Name: The Last Theft - Akharin serghat - آخرین سرقت
Story Line: This comedic tale of a pair of lovable rogues thrown together by their insatiable appetites for stealing focuses on Naser, a petty thief who steals anything he can, be it hubcaps, stereos, or just about anything he can get his hands on. One day, a theft takes an unexpected turn when he opens a car door to find Davood, another would-be thief. After some bickering, the pair decide to steal the car together. When Naser subsequently meets Davood's sister, a romance begins to bloom. Davood, meanwhile, contends with his old flame, Mojgan. A blend of romance, humor, and drama, this movie has something for everyone.
Actor: Nima Shahrokh Shahi ( نیما شاهرخ شاهی )

Name: Once Upon a Time - Yeki Bood Yeki Nabood -  یکی بود یکی نبود
Story Line: In 'Once upon a time,' ('Yeki Bood Yeki Nabood', 2000), a magical letter transports two men, Fahrad and Iraj, to a small house in the middle of the countryside - and into a world that's filled with cute talking animals.The men are happy to go along with it, but when the animals follow them back to the city, there are much bigger problems to solve. A delightful film for young children.

Name: The Juggler - Tardast - تردست
Story Line: Asad (Shahram Haghigat Doost) is being plagued by the nuisance ghost of his dead mother and, in his attempt to escape her, sets in motion a series of hilarious events. As he tries to rob a house, he is caught by the homeowner, who then follows him on his wacky adventures. Lighthearted comedy with zany results.
Actor: Shahram Haghighat Doost ( شهرام حقیقت دوست )

Name: Dream On - Be Hamin Khiyal Bash - به همین خیال باش
Story Line: Family comedy following the lives of three sons after the death of their father. When it is revealed during the reading of the will that a mysterious Javad has inherited the house, the three siblings seek to track him down and expose a family secret that has lain hidden for years.

Name: Tehran, Nature in a Coma - Tehran, Tabiate Be Yaghma Raft - تهران طبیعت به یغما رفته
Story Line: 'Tehran, Nature in a Coma' whisks you away to the past so you can witness how Tehran has developed throughout the ages from the perspective of agriculture, farming and animals – traversing through what was, and still is, an enormous part of Iranian society. A documentary that presents just how essential and life-changing the development of crop farming was to Tehran and the wider region. A fascinating historical journey of man and nature.

Name: My Tribe, Kormanj - Ile Man Kormanj - ایل من کرمانج
Story Line:
A series of 49 documentary films by 31 filmmakers, Children of the Land of Iran provides a window into the traditions, rituals and people within the rich and diverse culture of Iran. 

In Khorasan, there are around 300 small and large Kurdish Kormanj tribes who live in various areas in the region. During the Safavid era, these tribes were moved on several occasions from the west of Iran to Khorasan. Now these tribes make up an important part of the region. Bahram Azimpour’s 'My Tribe, Kormanj' provides fascinating insight into the cultural traditions of the Kormanji, spanning 20 years. The documentary specifically follows the lives, work and celebrations of women and children of the Kormanj tribe in the Dargaz region. A film that relies heavily on its cinematography to unlock a hidden world through rarely seen footage, 'My Tribe Kormanj' is not to be missed.

Name: Narration of a Sorrow - Revayati Az Yek Andoh - روایتی از یک اندوه
Story Line: This intriguing film centres around a conversation between a wife and her husband as they meet at a restaurant. The wife suspiciously regards her husband, before the lights in the restaurant ominously go out. The woman then embarks on a disturbing story about a wife murdering her adulterous husband in his sleep. The ambiguous ending leaves the audience guessing about really happened in this sinister psychological film.

Name: Metallic Volume - Hajme Felezi - حجم فلزی
Story Line: Raya Nasiri's short film passes wonderfully through a mix of emotional states, providing the audience with an unresolved but poignant encounter with a difficult issue. When a young girl mysteriously appears in the back of a woman's car, her initial confusion quickly turns to peace, and a painful dilemma suddenly becomes much simpler. Yet this strange occurrence may not be the hope that she needed, and the peace she feels may only be a prelude to a dark fate.

Name: Retired - Bazneshasteh - بازنشسته
Story Line: A newly retired businessman doesn't quite know what to do with himself in this amusing dramatic short. Having gone to work as usual one morning, our hero suddenly remembers that he has begun his life as a pensioner. What to do? How will he spend his days? As he meanders from libraries to parks, he meets some new faces and learns some life lessons along the way. A charming drama.

Name: The Last Deduction
Story Line: This hugely imaginative short film documents a couple's unravelling relationship through the eyes of their young son, Sina. Sina carries his video camera from room to room in the family apartment, filming his toys, the drawings on his wall, the fish magnet on the refrigerator, and other small details that capture a young child's interest. However, it soon becomes clear that some kind of altercation is occuring between his mother and father. Despite Sina's wails of protest, the situation escalates with terrible consequences. Mostly filmed in real-time, this film is a mesmerizing, authentic account of marital discord.

Name: The Ceremony - Marasem - مراسم
Story Line: Saeed Hadadi's short film provides footage of the yearly ceremony honoring one of Shia Islam's great religious leaders, Imam Hossain, who was martyred around 1400 years ago. Using dynamic sound editing and clever camera work, 'The Ceremony' spans the day's celebration, capturing the atmospheres of bustling crowds, musical performances and chanting alike while managing to evoke the deeper meanings of the ritual.

Name: Pink Sense - Hesse Soorati - حس صورتی
Story Line: A theater director named Raha must juggle an unplanned pregnancy with an imminent performance night, in this unconventional drama. She finds herself conflicted with emotions about her prospective motherhood, and her sense of uncertainty is reflected in the narrative of the film. This story experiments with a non-linear structure, as a pink balloon acts prophetically in indicating what her final decision will be.

Name: Snowy Dreams - Royahaye Barfi - رویاهای برفی
Story Line: Sometimes the truth is hard to accept. A headman of a tiny village lives with his wife Baji in freezing conditions,  and struggles with his duties as the community's adviser. Baji, meanwhile, is losing her sight. They wistfully await the return of their son Rebowar, who is doing military service. As more and more of the villagers succumb to the temptation of city living, the couple must learn to accept their situation for what it is. Melancholy and atmospheric, this short film is a lesson in coping.

Name: The Runaway Hooked Fish - Mahi ba Ghollab Gorikhteh - ماهی با قلاب گریخته
Story Line: A man is desperate to see his daughter in this surreal short by Naseh Kamgari. Through a locked door, the pair attempt to converse with one another, uncovering a few home truths in the process. Featuring theatrical lighting and impressive sets, this film's theatrical qualities sets it apart from the rest.

Name: Pacific Coast - Sahele Oghyanos Aram - ساحل اقیانوس آرام
Story Line: A unique take on the Iraq war, most notably for its subject matter; we are presented with an American perspective of events. In candid interviews with U.S. veterans and their relatives, this film pieces together Iran's relationship with Iraq, as witnessed by the American soldiers who served. Boasting stunning aerial shots and crisp cinematography, this documentary is a lesson on how the mentalities of nations are perceived by outsiders.

Name: Something Like Me - Chizi Shabihe Man - چیزی شبیه من
Story Line: A 26-year-old filmmaker Mona Zahed ventures to Afghanistan on a journey to experience and witness a dangerous environment of war. The documentary starts by Mona looking at footage from the Iran-Iraq war on its anniversary in 2001, briefly explaining the purpose of this documentary. As Mona and her crew cross the border into Afghanistan, she begins a journey of discovery and knowledge. Throughout the journey, Mona manages to conduct a series of interviews from the Taliban to the citizens of Afghanistan. What makes this film interesting is Mona's courageous attitude, as she is unafraid to ask controversial questions and confront anyone in her way to acquire the answers she seeks.

Name: Hawraman - Huraman - هه ورامان
Story Line:
A series of 49 documentary films by 31 filmmakers, Children of the Land of Iran provides a window into the traditions, rituals and people within the rich and diverse culture of Iran.

This documentary welcomes us to the Kurdish region of Hawraman, located in Kermanshah in Western Iran, beginning with stunning shots of its mountainous landscape and its native wildlife. With only minor dialogue to camera from three men of differing generations, the film is generally observational, allowing the area and customs to speak for themselves. The footage initially explores the vast wealth of the region, before moving on to more diverse territory.

Name: Dream of Life - Royai Zandagi - رویای زندگی
Story Line: When a fire devastates an elementary school in a rural village, many children are left with catastrophic burn injuries. Suffering from sever skin and organ damage, the young victims bravely come forward to share their recollections of that dreadful day. A harrowing documentary that highlights the courage of youngsters who try to resume normality despite their circumstances.

Name: Mokarrameh, Memories and Dreams - Mokarramh, Khaterat va Royaha - خاطرات و رویاهای مکرمه
Story Line: This documentary from Iranian filmmaker Ebrahim Mokhtari traces the fascinating life and works of artist Mokarrameh. Despite having no formal training as an artist, Mokarrameh started painting at the age of 63 after the death of her husband. She was noticed by the art world a few years later, and went on to receive an array of honors for her original and brightly colored works. This film is a great tribute to a woman with a wonderful talent.

Name: Modern Iranian Art - Honar Modern Irani - هنر مدرن ایرانی
Story Line: With characteristic depth of knowledge and artistic vision, Khosrow Sinai sheds light on the origin and progress of the modern art movement in Iran. Beginning with the vital introduction of cubism to Iran in the 1940s, Sinai follows the paths of the pioneers that made the Modern Movement possible. Exploring the work of these artists, and providing insights into their inspirations and typical subject matter, the film is a must see for anyone interested in art.

Name: Mission Impossible - Mamooriate Gheire Momken - ماموریت غیرممکن
Story Line: A short documentary about a gamer who must find an appropriate game for his nephew who has come to stay with him. Under his own criteria, the game must be suitable for his nephew's vast amount of energy, suitable for play in apartments and also Iranian. As the filmmaker strives to find the perfect game for his nephew, he finds that he not only underestimates his young friend, but that their cultural touchstones aren't the same at all. Switching from genre to genre, coming across massively multiplayer online games and finding war games, released years ago, that seem to predict current conflicts between the U.S and the Middle East.
Producer: Jafar Sanei Moghadam ( جعفر صانعی مقدم )

Name: She is A Man, He is A Woman - Ou Yek Mard va Ou Yek Zan - او یک مرد و او یک زن
Story Line: This documentary explores the thoughts and emotions of Iran's transvestites and examines the issues around family and society. It also has interesting interviews with doctors who help with the sex changes.

Name: Grey Blood Vessels - Raghaye Khakestari - رگهای خاکستری
Story Line: This moving documentary short looks at the impoverished existence of a community of Iranian heroin addicts. Whilst the men inject in one room of their dilapidated accommodation, and the women smoke in another, they are visited daily by a group of charity workers who provide them with clean equipment. Most are infected with HIV, including one of the workers who was attacked with a contaminated glass bottle. Elsewhere, the women seek advice and medical assistance from a local sexual health clinic. Simple shots and natural light serve to emphasize the stark circumstances.

Name: Fire and Fog - Atash Va Meh - آتش و مه
Story Line: Mohammad Khalilzadeh's documentary follows sociology student Farzi Nejad, his professor Dr Patrov, and fellow student Golbano, as they conduct intimate research into Iran's Gilan Province. As he travels through Gilan's mountainous terrain, meeting its people and immersing himself in its culture, Farzi learns broadly about the social history, traditions and agricultural customs of the region. However, the special focus of the film is on the Alam-Vachini ceremony performed there, and a bonfire gathering held before it which celebrates fire as a sign God's cleansing power. These scenes, alongside Farzi's commentary, provide a fascinating insight into a beautiful area of Iran.

Name: World's Children - Bache Haye Jahan - بچه های جهان
Story Line: "World's Children" is Hamed Saadet's honest and refreshing exploration of the lives of young Afghan refugees in Iran. The film captures the difficult nature of the children's experience with a vivid poignancy, as they are largely rejected by Iranian society and deprived of essential documentation such as ID cards. Yet, focusing on a school set up to teach Afghan children, it also shows the joy and refuge they can find in education when they are provided with it.

Name: Zinat, One Special Day - Zinat, Yek Rooze Bekhosoos - زینت، یک روز به خصوص
Story Line: Ebrahim Mokhtari's documentary provides insight into the life of Zinat, an inspirational woman who lives on the Island of Qeshm in the south of Iran. Zinat was the first woman from the island to remove the traditional facemask (Boregheh) put on by women when they are married, and worn for their whole lives. However, the film focuses largely on her social and political activities, as, determined to improve the living conditions of her fellow villagers, she presents herself as a candidate in the 1999 local elections. The film records the positive and negative reactions expressed by Zinat's visitors on the day of the election, which have particular emphasis on the subject of women's place in Iranian society.

Name: Countdown - Shomaresh Makous - شمارش معکوس
Story Line: 'Countdown' comments on the huge success that Iranian women are having in academia. Underlining the importance that the younger generation places in education, the film focuses on Tehrani teenager Parisa a few weeks before she takes her university entry exams. Providing intimate access to her life, and the life of her family, the film captures a sense of the exceptionally hard work Parisa throws into her studies. While providing broader social observations, this film is also a fascinating insight into the changing roles and broader opportunities of women in modern Iran.

Name: Drawing Contest - Mosabeghe Naghashi - مسابقه نقاشی
Story Line: Mehrdad Farid's documentary revolves around the judge of a drawing contest held for high school students. Having recently announced the winners in the local press, he is contacted by the father of one of the successful entrants, Seyedeh Akram, who reveals that his daughter did not actually draw her winning picture. It transpires that a teenager and artistic prodigy from a neighbouring family has been asking other students to submit his work under their own names in order to split the prize money with them. As the judge mediates a reconciliation between the two families, the issues of wealth, honour and loyalty are brought into the open.

Name: A Buried Treasure - Dafineh - دفینه
Story Line: As industrial factories increasingly replace the demand for handmade textiles, this documentary reflects on the dying art of weaving. A tradition with a 6 thousand year history in Iran, and surrounded by a rich mythology, Reza Erfani Zaboli and Hossein Rasti's film laments the modern decline of weaving fabrics. Beautifully shot images of looms and textiles add emphasise to the loss of artistic creativity brought about by industrial production, while first hand reports from weavers bring an air of sadness and invoke a desire to keep the tradition alive.

Name: The Children Play in the Marsh - Bache Ha Dar Hur Bazi Mikonand - بچه ها در هور بازی می کنند
Story Line:
A series of 49 documentary films by 31 filmmakers, Children of the Land of Iran provides a window into the traditions, rituals and people within the rich and diverse culture of Iran.

Filmed on and arround a single body of water, this documentary portrays a single community as they live off the land and river. Accompanied by an evocative musical score and narrated by children, it follows the enjoyments and habits of men, women and children as they go through their daily life.

Name: Finally - Dar Enteha - در انتها
Story Line: After a terrible car accident on a mountain road, a young man enduring military service, meets a driver, and they both share a journey together. Throughout the short film, the viewer is positioned with the two men as though we are accompanying them, and experiencing their car journey alongside them. Various phone calls and mishaps derail their journey along the way, but what awaits them is a tragedy that they could have never foreseen.

Name: Fight Thou Earthly One - Bejang Zamini - بجنگ زمینی
Story Line: A devastating explosion marks the beginning of this harrowing short from director Raya Nasiri. A woman and her young child are trapped under the rubble of an obliterated building. As the mother struggles to free herself, the plaintive cries of her child pierce the air. It is not clear if the two will escape with their lives from the claustrophobic confines of the debris.

Name: Handycam
Story Line: 'Handycam' is a short film about a young girl who receives a small video camera as a gift. Her father warns her not to play with it while he is away. Of course, his words fall on deaf ears, and the result is a realistic glimpse into one family's home life.

Name: Falling - Hoboot - هبوط
Story Line: Karim Azimi's short film is a dream-like meditation on the fragile line between survival and death. Set in the haunting backdrop of a desert landscape, strange figures carry fish bowls back and forth in a metaphoric struggle to sustain life. The images are powerful and evocative in their juxtaposition of the familiar with the surreal, and the atmospheric sound effects add further allure to the captivating visual scenes.

Name: Don't Talk To Me - Ba Man Harf Nazan - با من حرف نزن
Story Line: This film explores the complex relationship between two young women. One of them is in an unhappy relationship with a man. She seeks happiness and comfort in the company of another woman. It soon becomes clear that their intentions toward one another are more than platonic in this engrossing, daring short from Rasoul Adhami.

Name: Convicted - Mahkoum - محکوم
Story Line: A woman travels across the desert to visit her imprisoned husband, imploring his guards to let her see him and give him food. The guards reluctantly let her in, but tell her she will not be able to visit her husband. They seem more interested in having some company for themselves, in the lonely context of the barren and expansive landscape. The ambiguous ending leads us to ponder the fate of her captive husband. This film successfully contrasts the open desert with the claustrophobic prison and has a subtly haunting appeal.

Name: Toghrol Tower - Borje Toghrol
Story Line: A cantankerous old man is determined to find the Toghrol tower, but no-one he asks seems to be aware of its existence. He enters a cab, and asks the driver to take him there, however the driver also seems clueless as to its whereabouts. The driver leads him to buildings that clearly do not resemble the historical monument, infuriating the old man. However, the driver also becomes set on finding the tower and the next day they set out again, but will they ever be able to find this fabled destination? This humorous drama plays out in a light-hearted fashion and the last scene is uplifting and rewarding for the characters and audience alike.

Name: Some Place Behind the Clouds - Poshte Abrha Jaeest - پشت ابرها جاییست
Story Line: This philosophical film offers a thought-provoking meditation on nature, education and life. Set in a hill village in northern Iran, 'Some Place Behind the Clouds' shows the education of a group of young boys under a wise elderly man, who teaches them about the Qu'ran. There is a heavenly quality to this film, in the context of the misty mountains and beautiful scenery, and a serene peace follows the everyday lives of the villagers.

Name: Like Everyday - Mesle Har Rooz - مثل هر روز
Story Line: A middle-aged deliveryman, who spends the most of life capturing the world through video, has his simple life thrown into of chaos when his latest delivery turns out to be a woman in the feverish midst of labor. Forced to bring the woman to hospital, the man gradually gets to know the woman through her belongings. As a result, he begins to develop a keen interest in her as he wanders through the maze of hospital corridors.

Name: Leila's Present - Hedyeye Leila
Saba - صبا
Story Line:
Duty, love and longing are all themes that intertwine seamlessly in this beautifully shot drama. When her sister dies, the caring, dutiful Saba is left to take care of her niece along with her own son. Saba is a loving woman who connects instantly with her beaming, spirited young niece. Whilst Saba works as a dressmaker, and takes care of both children, it is apparent she longs for something more. This touching and poignant short film gives the audience a nuanced character study and leaves them truly rooting for Saba to find happiness.

Synopsis by IMVbox.com

Name: Around This Time - Hodoode In Saat - حوالی این ساعت
Story Line: A fragile old man sits every day on a park bench, listening to old tunes and reading the paper as part of his daily routine. One day, this somewhat mundane existence is broken. As the old man falls asleep, an enigmatic child on a bicycle wakes him up with his horn.

Name: And Nothing Else - Va Digar Hich - ودیگرهیچ
Story Line: 'And Nothing Else' is a short film that focuses on a tormented and suffering woman. Her silence through the film so effectively conveys her utter anguish, which is a result of the strain and pressure of being a housewife. The protagonist's pain and suffering completely opposes the wonderfully shot film. The film really captures the beauty of Iran. Visually vibrant and evocative, the film’s inspiring image of Iran contrasts with the protagonist's struggle, which makes her journey all the more harrowing.

Name: The Silent Companion - Hamsafare Khamoush -  همسفر خاموش
Story Line: A man crosses a war border by boat and thereby risks his life in order to present a wedding dress to his fiance. Set during the Iran-Iraq war, this peculiar yet touching short is about dignity and humanity. An anecdote against the war.

Name: Western Tehran Eastern Tehran - Tehran Gharbi Tehran Sharghi
Story Line: Western Tehran Eastern Tehran (Tehran Gharbi Tehran Sharghi) is a short film about a young man explanation of how fate and time led to the car accident he was involved in which he does not feel guilty about. In this short film this young man goes through all the events that led to his accident on the day before.
Sound: Fardin Saheb Zamani ( فردین صاحب زمانی )

Name: The May House - Khaneye Ordibehesht - خانه اردیبهشت
Story Line: Amir Hossein Birjandi's ode to the disappearing old houses of a Tehran neighborhood is a history lesson on a form of architecture being encroached upon by urban modernisation. With beautifully shot images of the streets and buildings of the city and a poetic voice-over, together with expert interviews, this is a snapshot of a neglected part of Tehran’s architectural heritage.

Name: Tehran, the Lost City - Tehran, Shahre Gomshodeh - طهران شهر گمشده
Story Line: 'Tehran, the Lost City' (Tehran, Shahre Gomshodeh) is a documentary about the development of Tehran city, and the criticism of the industrialisation which has led to Tehran losing its identity as a place for traditional architecture. This documentary takes the audience to the oldest parts of Tehran to show appreciation of the architecture that has lasted throughout the years.

Name: Song of Silence - Avazhaye Sokoot -  آوازهای سکوت
Story Line: The Iranian government plans to make Tehran one of the most luxurious cities in the world. This documentary follows a group of local architects, employed to devise a new building for a retail shopping center in an attempt to bring business to the area. Through collaboration with the passionate locals, the is creating a capital that will be considered one of the most beautiful in the world. Director Khosrow Sinai delights with this optimistic documentary on the future plans for Tehran.

Name: Salinger Reading in the Park - Salinger Khani Dar Park - سالینجر خوانی در پارک
Story Line: This documentary centers around a park, its visitors and their various habits. The narrator tells the story of the park and examines the ways in which it is used as a public space, including a variety of scenes with people relaxing, exercising and walking. A simple but immersive look into how humans interact with their surroundings.

Name: Half-Life Nature - Tabiate Nime Jan - طبیعت نیمه جان
Story Line: 'Half-Life Nature' is a documentary criticizing the progress of industrialization in Tehran, and charting the correlation of such industrialization with the destruction of nature. In a condemnation of the speed in which Tehran is becoming more and more urbanized, the film covers an array of the environmental issues blighting the city's wildlife and human populations. Noise, deforestation, pollution, and the resulting decline of the bird population all come under fire in Omid Abdollahi's awareness-rousing short.

Name: Green Card - Kart Sabz - کارت سبز
Story Line: A human interest, society documentary, directed by Mohammad H Jafari, 'Green Card' recalls the story of one's upbringing in Afghanistan and how the current and political climate affects individual opportunities. The passenger in this documentary, travels around the country, making discoveries about the welfare of individuals in society. A documentary which values the importance of individuals being persistent in life to make the most out of success.

Name: Witnesses of History - Govahan Tarikh - گواهان تاریخ
Story Line: Khosrow Sinai was commissioned by the National Bank of Iran to produce a documentary about the national jewelry collection. His final product, 'Witnesses of History', has some stunning visuals of the collection. Accompanied by Sinai's voiceover, the images offer up to the audience Iran's finest gems, which have indeed witnessed Iran's tumultuous history.

Name: Don't Forget Our Date - Ghararemon Yadet Nareh - قرارمون یادت نره
Story Line: 'Don't Forget Our Date' is a thoughtful insight into the life of a musician. Our protagonist is the look-a-like of famous pop star, Nadin. We accompany him through his jam sessions, music production, studio recordings and even a trip to the barber. Director Katayoun Arsanjani indulges us with an affectionate look at the creative process of an 'almost' pop icon.

Name: Coffee After Friday Pray  - Ghahvah Baad Az Namaz Jomah - قهوه بعد از نماز جمعه
Story Line: Directors Katayoun Arsanjani and Pooyan Shahrokhi highlight the thriving coffee shop culture that has increased in popularity every Friday after prayers. This ritual has become a central hub of activity, discussion and community. 'Coffee After Friday Pray' is an intriguing look into how religion plays an integral part in social interaction in contemporary Iran.

Name: All My Dreams - Tamame Arezouhaye Man - تمام آرزوهای من
Story Line: Mehdi Ghorbanpour's documentary is a look at the varying aspirations of several young people from different backgrounds. Some dream of making films, some want to train as musicians and others seek to further their academic studies. Some have to take exams, others work tiring jobs while continuing to believe in their dreams. The film follows this emerging generation of Iranians and wonders what will become of their futures.

Name: This is life - Zendegi Hamin Ast - زندگی همین است
Story Line: Filmed during the time of the Reform Movement in the late 1990s, this documentary explores the lives of Iranian students. As different students narrate their life stories, interests and views of the political landscape in Iran, a fascinating portrait of the period begins to emerge. Pirooz Kalantari's film is an excellent examination of what it means to be a student in post-1979 Iran.

Name: Shah Ahmad's Shrine - Haft Kouh Morad - هفت کوه مراد
Story Line: This documentary sheds light on the extraordinary pilgrimage taken by many to Shah Ahmad's shrine. Consisting of a series of 9 different ceremonies, starting at Mount Kibar, the ritual is performed by multitudes of devoted pilgrims every year. Attracted by Ahmad's miracles, and the esoteric beauty of the landscape in which the pilgrimage takes place, this film records the followers of the legendary figure on their sacred journey.

Name: Mehr Month of Reunion - Mehr Mahe Didar - مهر ماه دیدار
Story Line: Filmed at a teacher-parent open day at a school promoting progressive teaching methods, Hamid Reza Ghotbi's documentary is a thought-provoking reflection on how Iran's education system might be changed for the better. While the school's philosophy aims to provide a creative environment as a means towards more productive learning, teachers and parents talk about a broad spectrum of issues. How to deal with unruly children, rewarding success, learning facilities, and the need for teachers to emotional engage with pupils, are just some of the issues up for debate in this short film committed to improving Iranian schools.

Name: Recipe of Niloofar - Tarze Tahie Niloofar - طرز تهیه نیلوفر
Story Line:
A fascinating and often heart-warming documentary providing an insight into the making of the awarded-winning film 'Niloofar'. In 'Recipe of Niloofar', director Sabine El Gemayel gives an insight into the making of her successful film, taking the audience into the intimate process of writing and directing. Not just for fans of the original feature, this is a wonderful documentary of creative collaboration, showing the smooth interactions of an international team of filmmakers within a backdrop of the good-natured people of Iran.

Synopsis by IMVBox

Name: Eyes - Chashm ha - چشم ها
Story Line: Mohammad Reza Fartousi's eye-opening documentary focuses on young photographer Nadia Abdullah's brave efforts to record social unrest in Yemen. Using Abdullah's powerful and often disturbing images to capture the atmosphere of revolution, the film follows her as she works while providing insights into her personal aims and thoughts on photography. First inspired to document the revolution by the horror of seeing innocent people wounded in a hospital, she talks passionately about the corrupt politics of Yemen, her experience of witnessing bloodshed, and what she sees as the revolutionary art of photography.

Name: Born Again - Noghte Sefr - نقطه صفر
Story Line: Sohrab Khosravi's short documentary provides a glimpse into the life of Hojat Ghazvini, who at the age of 40 gave up his life in society to live alone in the desert. Filmed in 2000, the then 55 year-old Hojat reflects on his reasons for giving up his first life and being 'born again' to live a second life. The film provides intriguing footage of his daily life, while Hojat tells accounts of the dangers he has faced and talks about his philosophical views.

Name: Between Shadow and Light - Miane Sayeh va Nour - میان سایه و نور
Story Line: Khosrow Sinai's short film revolves around the work of Farah Ossouli, an artist who invents symbolic characters and stories in order to express her views about life. Depicting her characters in expertly composed and beautifully coloured paintings, which blend a traditional Persian painting style with a modern touch, Farah Ossouli's art has been exhibited internationally and is deservedly award-winning. Here, it is given a new dimension through pantomime and poetic narrative. As the film follows Ossouli creating a new work, dramatic performances pieces bring her characters to life in a surreal blend of fly-on-the-wall observation and symbolic imagery.

Name: Behind the Scenes: Sweet Agony - Poshte Sahneh: Masaeb Shirin - پشت صحنه مصائب شیرین
Story Line: Director Alireza Davoudnejad gives us a brief, behind-the-scenes insight into the making of his own film 'Sweet Agony'. His original film is based around two teenagers, betrothed since childhood, who retain their attachment into adolescence. When their family decides to end the relationship, on the basis that it will not be beneficial to the long-term prospects of either, the young couple decide that marriage is the answer to their problem. In his documentary, Davoudnejad introduces us to his film-making process and the actors that give life to these tormented characters.

Name: Symphony of the City - Samfonie Shahr - سمفونی شهر
Story Line: Sound is utilised to breathtaking effect in this documentary by Mohammed Afarideh about the trappings of modern day city-life in Tehran. A split-frame is also used to express the city's transformation as it passes through the decades. 'Symphony of the City' begins with grainy black and white footage of camel-drawn carriages and low stone buildings. This cuts to a beautiful sweeping shot of the skyscrapers of modern Tehran. A cacophony of noises flood in, from the incessant beeping of traffic jams to the jarring screech of hydraulic drills. This film effectively questions the intrusive levels of noise that have caused health problems amongst residents on Tehran, critiquing the processes of industrialization and modernization.

Name: Shovel Moving- Bilgardani - بیل گردانی
Story Line: Yousef Nikfam's documentary reveals the tradition of Shovel Moving, a ceremonial celebration performed in Nimevar in the Markazi province of Iran. Delving into the tradition's history, and the various competitions and performances which make up the yearly celebration, the film is an interesting look at the way in which a community can come together through ceremony.

Name: I Like Iran - Man Iran Ra Dost Daram - من ایران را دوست دارم
Story Line: Khosrow Sinai's documentary is a unique tribute to the great nation of Iran, as seen from the eyes of its international tourist trade. Cutting together fly-on-the-wall and interview footage of people from different countries around the world during the 1960s and 1970s, the film provides a broad but intimate insight into how visitors have enjoyed Iran. From guided tours, trekking around the country and revelling in Iranian music to footage of the global diversity of tourists at the airport, the experience of Iran through foreign eyes is given a vivid and aspirational representation here.

Name: South of Iran Noban - Jonoobe Iran Noban -  جنوب ایران نوبان
Story Line: 'South of Iran' is a documentary series that details the evolution of Southern Iranian music, while explaining how it was influenced by various cultures throughout history. It also provides insight into how the instruments developed. This episode explores music which is played during special ceremonies which are held to pacify the noban - a harmful wind which is associated with spirit possession beliefs among people from the Southern coastal regions of Iran.  Among other things, the ceremony consists of playing a specific beat of drums.

Name: What Lies Beneath - Ancheh Dar Zir Nahofteh - آنچه در زیر نهفته
Story Line: Documentary centering on a huge sculpture of Shah Abbas in Isfahan, which along with all other statues was torn down after the Islamic Revolution. Interviewing the masterpiece's creator Iraj Mohammadi and other important figures surrounding the issue, the film debates the relevance of statues to a city’s cultural heritage and the socio-political history of Isfahan and the Revolution. While it's unknown what happened to his statue, Mohammadi also talks about his unending search for it as the film recounts the stories that surround its mysterious disappearance.

Name: My Share From Khazar - Sahme Man Az Khazar - سهم من از خزر
Story Line: Opening with scenes from a sunset fishing trip, Katayoun Arsanjani takes us into an unknown world. Split between direct interviews with portions of city life shot from a hidden camera, we are granted access to intimate conversations with the working people that inhabit the city. 'My Share From Khazar' contrasts the beauty of nature, namely the sea, with the daily grind and urban grit of city life.

Name: In Search of Anonymity - Dar Jostejooye Gomnami  - در جستجوی گمنامی
Story Line: Alireza Karami's documentary looks at the life and career of Professor Rahavard, who created a uniquely well-stocked library of over 8000 books during the course of a 70 year period. In the film, old students, friends and colleagues recall the collection.

Name: Absolute Value - Ghadre Motlagh - قدر مطلق
Story Line: In this short film, a young couple have found themselves in substantial debt, having refused to repay a loan to the bank. Tense and fearful of the repercussions, the couple are unsure of what to do, but if they fail to repay the loan, they will face imprisonment and lose all their finances. The whole film takes place in the comfort of the couple’s home, as they contemplate their situation. ‘Absolute Value’ is a film ultimately about dilemma and being forced to make a decision.

Name: South of Iran Mashayekh - Jonoobe Iran Mashayekh - جنوب ایران مشایخ
Story Line: 'South of Iran' is a documentary series showing Southern Iranian music, while explaining how it was influenced by various cultures throughout history and exploring how its instruments developed. This episode explores Mashayekh music, which is played during special ceremonies that are held by people from the coastal regions of South Iran. The ceremony aims to pacify a sort of 'harmful wind' which their beliefs associate with spirit possession, and the music involves playing a specific drumbeat in order to do this. Fascinating insight into regional rituals and beliefs.

Name: South of Iran Zar - Jonoobe Iran Zar - جنوب ایران زار
Story Line: "South of Iran" is a documentary series showing Southern Iranian music, while explaining how it was influenced by various cultures throughout history. This final episode explores Zar music, which is played during special ceremonies that are held specifically for the treatment of sick people. As the patient listens to the music, constantly moving their body to the rhythm, it is believed the combined effects of music, movement and lyrics will ease their pain. Alongside footage of Zar music in action, this film also provides a history of its tradition.

Name: Impression of a City - Tehran Emrooz - تهران امروز
Story Line: Khosrow Sinai's documentary is a loving tribute to Tehran, delving into the city's history and commenting on the nature of modern life there. From famous architectural landmarks to winding back alleys, from Tehran's theatre culture and museum treasures to congested traffic and quiet parks, Sinai glances everywhere with a thoughtful and adoring eye. But he also lets the city do its own talking, providing a rich array of visual imagery which beautifully conveys the diversity of Tehran’s people and places.

Name: Laleh and Ladan - Laleh Va Ladan - لاله و لادن
Story Line: Mohammed H. Jafari's thought-provoking documentary follows the lives of Laleh and Laden, twins conjoined at the head, as they contemplate surgical separation. Heart-breaking and heart-warming by turns, the film provides an intimate insight into the personal interaction of the twins and their reasons for wanting the life-threatening operation. Yet as Laleh and Laden’s hopes and fears for the future are delicately revealed, Jafari also explores the wider moral dilemma of how two inseparable people are to be understood by the law.

Name: Sahra - صحرا
Story Line: This short film is set in an idyllic rural area in Iran, and it follows the titular character Sahra, who is trapped in an unhappy marriage. Eager to divorce her husband, as her heart clearly lies elsewhere. She is apart of an oppressive clan and when she goes against their wishes, she becomes the centre of attention in the province. 'Sahra' focuses on the fractured and complicated relationships between people.

Name: Mr Library - Aghaye Ketabkhaneh - آقای کتابخانه
Story Line: Davoud Ashrafi's 'Mr Library' documents the foundation of the Malek National Library and Museum Institution. Centered in Tehran, the library has one of the biggest collections of precious manuscripts in Iran, and the film is a fascinating insight into the great history behind its establishment. Accompanied by clips of different sections of the library and the museum, Ashrafi also provides an informative glimpse into the insititution's broader collection of books and artefacts.

Name: Mom - Maman
Haj Mosavar
Story Line: Director Khosrow Sinai takes a delving look at the life of Iranian book illustrator, and Isfahan carpet designer, Haj Mosavar. Mosavar is considered a master of 20th century design, yet previous to the creation of this homage, little was documented about his life. Using stills and archive footage, Sinai introduces his work and life story to a modern day audience. 'Haj Mosavar' is an accomplished and illuminating piece constructed to interest and inspire.

Name: Where is Heaven - Behesht Kojast - بهشت کجاست
Story Line: This well-shot film takes place during the Afghanistan war and depicts an encounter between a young Afghan boy and a threatening American soldier. The boy is hiding in a small stone dwelling place after ISAF forces bombed his village when the American come barging in and they come face to face. Later the American hears the faint chant of US soldiers singing glorifying war chants and wanders out, but does not find his comrades, rather something far more traumatising.  This engaging war film effectively humanises both sides in the conflict and reminds the audience of the senselessness of war, whose victims are all too often innocent civilians.

Name: Willow And Wind - Beed O Baad - بید و باد
Story Line: A young school boy was ordered to walk a long way to purchase a piece of window glass larger than he could carry back to his school. The weather was bitter and the wind so strong that he almost failed on the road. He tried hard and finally moved the load back to the classroom where he was supposed to fix up a broken window. He was all alone and no one to turn for help. The glass blew crushed in pieces by the wind.

Name: The Red Ribbon - Robane Ghermez - روبان قرمز
Story Line: A man and a woman fight over the rights to a property.

Name: Tehran, A New Age - Tehran Rozegare No - طهران، روزگار نو
Story Line: In the early 40's, after his first visit to Turkey, Reza Shah who was impressed by the fact that Ataturk knew the population of his country ordered a census. In order for the census to properly work out, everyone had to stay home while the agents came to visit. A few government agents used this opportunity and rubbed a jewelry store in Lale zar, unaware of the fact that a piece of Khane-Mozzafar's marriage jewelry is between the rubbed items.
Editor: Varouzh Karim Masihi ( واروژ کریم مسیحی )

Name: The Prank - Shookhi - شوخی
Actor: Mohammad Reza Ghias Abadi (محمدرضا غیاث آبادی)

Name: Smell of Camphor, Fragrance of Jasmine - Bouye Cafour, Atre Yas - بوی کافور،عطر یاس
Story Line: Iranian filmmaker Bahman Farmanara wrote, directed, and stars in this autobiographical drama of an artist reaching beyond the limits of censorship

Name: The Ranger - Renger - رنجر
Story Line: After an intense battle in an Iraqi forest, Iranian soldier Morteza surrenders to the enemy. Dubious about the quality of care he will receive from his captors, his worst fears are realised when the commander of the Iraqi battalion, Sami Jaber, orders for him to be transferred to a deserted camp, one not listed under the supervision of the Red Cross. Kept in terrible conditions, faced on all sides by the cruelty of men, Morteza struggles not to lose track of who he is and what he is fighting for.

Name: The Rain Man - Marde Barani - مرد بارانی
Story Line: After years of trying to find a herbal cure for cancer, Dr Hadi Barani has a reputation for being more of a madman than a doctor. When old flame Ziba returns to his life after 18 years, however, she brings with her memories of a friend whose life he couldn't save - and new hopes for his research. But with complications in his family life, and a conspiracy being plotted against him, what will Ziba's return mean for Hadi in the end?
Actor: Mohsen Ghazi Moradi ( محسن قاضی مرادی )

Name: Born Under Libra - Motevalede Mahe Mehr - متولد ماه مهر
Story Line: A young Iranian couple find it all but impossible to reconcile their love with the strict moral and religious strictures that govern their lives in this controversial drama. A powerful film about politics, religion and love.
Director: Ahmad Reza Darvish ( احمد رضا درویش )
Writer: Ahmad Reza Darvish ( احمد رضا درویش )

Name: The Girl in Sneakers - Dokhtari Ba Kafsh Haye Katani - دختری با کفش‌ های کتانی
Story Line: A somewhat cynical take on Shakespeare's Romeo and Juliet, this film's romantic plot focuses on the troubles surrounding a young couple in love. Infatuated with teenage boy Aideen, Tadaei heads for school as usual one morning, but decides not to go after all. Instead, she roams the streets of Tehran over a 24 hour period. She makes up her mind not to return to home and run away with Aideen, much to the outrage of her parents, who are horrified at the idea of Tadaei being caught alone with a young man. Harangued by the police, Tadaei’s experiences make her change her mentality of love, and inevitably her pathway.
Writer: Peyman Ghassem Khani ( پیمان قاسم خانی )

Name: Sheida - شیدا
Story Line:
Farhad has lost his eyesight due to an injury sustained in battle. As part of his recovery, he is transferred to a temporary hospital, where he encounters young nurse Sheida. Sheida is surprised by his tolerance to the pain of his injury, but soon realises that her recitation of Quran verses has a miraculous calming effect on him. And as the two start to grow closer and Farhad begins to heal, they find themselves on the path between faith and hope, and the true nature of both is revealed to them.

Synopsis by IMVbox.com

Name: Iran is My Land - Iran Saraye Man Ast - ایران سرای من است
Story Line: 'Iran Is My Land' documents the journey of Sohrab, an itinerant writer, whose latest work, a book of Iranian poetry, requires a permit from Iran's censors in order to be published. Sohrab thus sets off on the road to Tehran in pursuit of this elusive document. As he ventures deeper into nature and immerses himself in his work, he encounters Persian poets from times long past, including the form of Saadi Shirazi, who provide comfort and guidance along his journey of inspiration.

Name: The Sky Full of Stars - Asemane Por Setareh - آسمان پر ستاره
Story Line: Shortly after the fall of the Shah, an old woman, Nasim, recollects memories from her youth. From the joyful visit of her nephew, Alireza, to the fight for her husband's freedom, she remembers the loss and the tragedies of her past. She relives each painful memory, from a time when she still believed the world would become a better place. A heartbreaking look at one woman's sense of loss.

Name: Locomotive Driver - Lokomotiv Ran - لوکوموتیوران
Story Line: Captivating wartime drama about a locomotive driver who is forced to flee to south Iran to escape the war raging around him. In doing so, he loses contact with his son who stays behind to defend the city. Years later the train driver and his family hope for the son's return. As time passes with no sign of the son, the family must instead look to each other for comfort and security.

Name: Alone in Tehran - Tanha Dar Tehran - تنها در تهران
Story Line: Pirooz Kalantari's documentary is a stylised portrait of 24 year old actress and student Benhaz Jafari, combining fly-on-the-wall observations with artistically shot moments of self-reflection. As Benhaz talks to friends, goes to acting auditions, and muses on her life, the film creates a moving image of a young woman who lost her parents at an early age and aspires to a carefree life just beyond her reach. Caught between acting, completing her dissertation on misogyny, and the pressure to marry, Benhaz's mood fluctuates between hope for the future and disappointment in this compelling narrative of her life.

Name: Siavash - Siyavash - سیاوش
Story Line: Siavash is a young man who is a musician of a pop band, sixteen years has passed since his father's martyrdom, and his mother married another man. At this time he is informed that his father is alive and will come back home

Name: Two Women - Do Zan - دو زن
Story Line: 'Two Women' tells the story of two friends who bonded over similar ambitions when the met at college, ended up living two very different lives. The film first introduces us to Roya, a strong, confident and carefree woman with a loving husband who is also her business partner. Out-of-the-blue, she is contacted by her old friend, Fereshteh, whose husband is in the hospital and to whom life hasn't been so kind. Through a series of flashbacks, we witness their friendship and how Fereshteh slowly had her dreams tarnished by the men around her. Now that the two are reunited, will Roya possibly be able to help her friend get back the hope she has lost?

Name: A Love Without Frontier - Eshghe bedoone marz - عشق بدون مرز
One Little Mistake - Yek Eshtebahe Koochooloo - یک اشتباه کوچولو
Parrots - Tootia - طوطیا
Story Line: Iraj Ghaderi's domestic drama that challenges the roles of men and women in society. Shaghayegh is the executive manager of the 'Independent Women's Cooperative', an organisation that is currently trying to fund the construction of a medical complex for local children. The project is in desperate need of money, and so Shaghayegh asks her husband Siavash to look after the house while she works round the clock to raise the necessary funds. When Siavash takes exception to this, resentful of his independent, hard-working wife, the clash of outdated ideals threatens to destroy the very relationship for which they are working so hard to build a future.

Name: The Hemlock - Shokaran - شوکران
Story Line: Mahmoud is a middle-class family man and business CEO who lives in the suburbs of modern Tehran. Though his wife Taraneh is dutiful and kind-hearted, she is about the only positive thing in his life: his factory is in severe financial straits and his business partner Khakpour has just been injured in a car accident. Visiting Khakpour in the hospital one day, Mahmoud crosses paths with beautiful female nurse Sima. Giving in to temptation, he agrees to a temporary marriage with her. Though Mahmoud is adamant he cannot see her once their license expires, Sima refuses to give him up so easily, and things come to a head when she reveals she is pregnant with his child. A thrilling moral tale about tradition, politics and the temptations of modern society.

Name: Bead - Mohreh - مهره
Story Line: A recently married woman plans to leave her hometown and start a new life in Tehran. A tragic event in the family interrupts her plans and means she has to stay put for longer than she had anticipated. A theft, a case of mistaken identity and a terrible accident all come together to produce a dark and gritty narrative in this gut wrenching drama.
Actor: Ateneh Faghih Nasiri ( آتنه فقیه نصیری‎‎ )

Name: Injured At War - Majroohe Jangi - مجروح جنگی
Story Line: Set in the midst of the Iran-Iraq war, the rural Kurdish village of Khorram Darreh captures Iraqi attention. The village's bunkers are ideal for the Iraqi army, who plan to use Khorram Darreh as a base to target the western regions of Iran. It is up to the intrepid Sayed Ghassem and his troops to come to the rescue of the villagers. However, their mission is far from straightforward, as anti-revolutionary factions do their best to hinder their progress. This tense thriller does not shy away from depicting the harsh reality of what it means to be at war.
Writer: Ensieh Shah Hosseini ( انسیه شاه حسینی‎ )

Name: Passion of Life - Shoore Zendegi - شور زندگی
The May Lady - Banoye Ordibehesht - بانوی اردیبهشت
Story Line: A woman edging into middle age must make some tough choices about her life and her work in this engaging drama from Iran. Forugh Kia (Minoo Farshi) is a documentary filmmaker in her early forties who has reached a crossroads in both her personal and professional lives. Forugh has been forced by economics to set aside more personal projects in order to accept a commission from a television network. A thoughtful examination on the importance of following your passions.

Name: Son of Mary - Pesare Maryam - پسر مریم
Story Line: Rahman is a milk delivery boy and mosque crier in a small village. Delivering milk amid the village's preparations for Ashura, he befriends a local priest, whose own preparations for the Feast of St. Mary go unnoticed by everyone except young Rahman. Much to the chagrin of his father and grandmother, Rahman assists the priest with his preparations. When the priest is injured falling from a ladder, Rahman elects to travel to the city to find the priest's brother. Against the backdrop of the festival, Rahman finds himself changed by his simple act of kindness as he learns of faith, loss and the righteous path of all of God's children.

Name: The Pear Tree - Derakhte Golabi - درخت گلابی
Story Line: Mahmoud (Homayoun Ershadi) is a successful writer and intellectual who retreats to his family's rural estate in order to overcome a severe case of writer's block. While there, he begins to contemplate his life, comparing it to a pear tree in the yard which has stopped producing fruit. From there, the film chronicles Mahmoud's memories of the past, including his love towards his adolescent cousin and his fervent hopes for the future. A searching examination of the Iranian middle class, as well as a touching insight into the frustration and ambition of a man trying to hold onto the dreams of days gone by, 'The Pear Tree' also marks the debut of internationally acclaimed actress Golshifteh Farahani.
Actor: Shahram Haghighat Doost ( شهرام حقیقت دوست )

Name: Red - Ghermez - قرمز
Story Line: 'Red', as the film's title suggests, is a story filled with tension, violence, crime and passion. The film focuses on the events surrounding the demise of a bitter marriage. However, the divorce marks the beginning of a vicious war between the former lovers. The husband Nasser, an irrational and dangerously reckless young man, does not hesitate to abuse his former wife Hasti - or anyone who dares to stop him. Accompanied by the couple's song, 'Red' is a portrayal of the grim consequences of madness.

Name: Hiva - هیوا
Story Line: Fifteen years after her husband Hamid was declared MIA in the war, Hiva decides to visit the places from their past in an attempt to move on with her life. Though she has received numerous marriage proposals, including from Hamid's fellow soldier Amir, she has yet to accept any of them, and she hopes that by saying a final goodbye to her missing husband she will be able to prepare her soul for a better future. She is not prepared however for the discovery that awaits her on her introspective journey.

Name: The Cart - Charkh - چرخ
Story Line: When he loses his football playing with a couple of friends, Alireza is caught by a neighbour trying to get it back. Reporting the offence to his parents, Alireza soon finds himself disciplined for his inconsiderate behaviour. As punishment, his father makes him spend the whole day in his cart as it travels about the city. Through a small peephole, Alireza watches the world go by outside, and as he does, he is treated to a new perspective on life, one which may ultimately help him patch things up with his father.

Name: Don - دان
Story Line: Don is the story of a young boy desperate to find work to help support his family and heroin addicted parents. Moving from employer to employer, Don, aged only 9 and illiterate, faces an almost impossible task without an identity card. Part of the Iranian New Wave, Abolfazl Jalili's use of non-actors gives the film the feeling of a documentary, as performers recreate lives so close to their own. From Don's point of view, the world is a tough place, but his determination to make the most of his situation is heartwarming.

Name: To Be or Not to Be - Boodan Ya Naboodan - بودن یا نبودن
Story Line: 'To Be or Not to Be' is the story of Anik Avanessian, a young woman suffering from a cardiac insufficiency that has caused her health to deteriorate to the point where she can no longer walk or speak without difficulty. With time running out, Anik is desperate for a heart transplant, but with her name just one on a list of 200, the chances of finding a suitable heart become increasingly unlikely. Anik's future rests in her ability, with her doctor, to convince the family of a brain-dead man to release their loved one's heart, so that it might live on in her. When it transpires that the man is the son of a disreputable criminal family, things go from bad to worse. A suspenseful tale of a woman doing her best to overcome the unimaginable, this film delivers an emotional punch.

Name: The Main Streak - Shahrag - شاهرگ
Story Line: A severed, buried map comes back to haunt its owners in this psychological thriller taking place after the revolution. In his mad quest for its pieces, General Azdi finds Mansoor, a young man trying to turn his life around and forces him into his old tricks. Mansoor encounters Major Farzin in his troubles and his life will never be the same. This thriller set in the drug-smuggling, gun-blazing underworld relies on the unexpected rather than the formulaic, a film where a doll could change everything.

Name: Leaning on The Wind - Tekye Bar Baad - تکیه بر باد
Story Line: A young man leaves the sleepy confines of his village and moves to the buzzing capital of Tehran to find a job. He leaves behind his mother and fiancee, promising to return after saving enough money for the wedding. Utterly engrossed in his new life in the capital city, he encounters someone captivating enough to make him almost forget about the life he left behind. However, a shocking announcement brings him back to cold reality.

Name: Naneh Lala and Her Children - Naneh Lala va Farzandanash - ننه لالا و فرزندانش
Story Line: Naneh Lala is an elderly woman living in a house scheduled for demolition to make way for a new avenue. With all her children moved away and no phone in the house to contact them, she is in a seemingly impossible situation with no hope. When her son calls a neighbor's phone inside a locked house, it is up to a local troupe of plucky children to get Naneh Lala there before it is too late. An energetic and charming family film.
Producer: Vahid Nikkhah Azad ( وحید نیکخواه آزاد )
Editor: Varouzh Karim Masihi ( واروژ کریم مسیحی )

Name: The Village That Was Lost - Dehkadei Ke Gom Shod - دهکده ای که گم شد
Story Line: 'The mountain has fallen over.' So says one of the villagers of a nearby town when director Jafari asks where the village of Abkar is. In this startling documentary, we look at the lives of several rural families as they come to terms with a recent landslide that smothered an entire village and killed its inhabitants. Scorching desert landscapes and groups of mourners create a desolate image as we learn more and more about the recent spate of accidents. A fascinating and sometimes terrifying look at Iran’s natural phenomenon.

Name: Baran and the Native - Baran Va Boomi - باران و بومی
Story Line: Aboard the top deck of a cruise ship, Baran, a young wealthy girl, notices a native boy who is dancing joyfully to beating drums. Baran arrives at a plush hotel on the mainland, however she seems somewhat disconsolate. Later she finds the native boy again and they begin to bond, playfully exploring the beach resort together. Later, the two go aboard a row-boat and the native dives down into the water to collect a pearl from the seabed for her. However, the ending leaves the audience to wonder if he was a figment of Baran's longing imagination all along. Well-shot and with a strong performance from Baran Kosari, this film perfectly captures the bittersweet pangs of young love.

Name: Glass Agency - Ajanse Shishei - آژانس شیشه ای
Story Line: 'The Glass Agency' is the story of a war veteran living in post war Iran. It depicts veterans who are suffering from social problems after the war. Society does not understand them and the standard social norms are not in harmony with their personalities.

Name: A Man Like Rain - Mardi Shabihe Baran - مردی شبیه باران
Story Line: Mansor Ghasemi an Iranian leader is captured by the Iraqis. But in the camp they don't know him so a spy is hired to go among the Iranian captures and recognize him. The Iranians manage to kill this spy but that lead the Iraqis to torture them and even cut their share of water just to force them to reveal the true identity of their leader.

Name: The Psycho - Ravani - روانی
Saray - سارای
Story Line: There is an old chant from old times between Azerbaijani tribes that tells the story of a girl named Saray. Saray was a beautiful girl from Moghan tribe and was in love with the head of the shepherds of the tribe, Aydin. On the other hand, the head of the tribe (Khan) is in love with Saray although he has a wife and some children. Saray drowns herself in the Aras river to prove her loyalty to Aydin and protect the dignity of the tribe...
Editor: Varouzh Karim Masihi ( واروژ کریم مسیحی )

Name: Wounded - Zakhmi - زخمی
Story Line: Coping with a wrongful conviction, widower Yaqub never stops caring for his son whilst away in prison. Finally released, he discovers his son has been kidnapped. Yearning to see his son once more, Yaqub sets off to rescue him. In this action-packed drama, emotions, along with stakes, are high.

Name: Behind the Night's Wall - Poshte Divare Shab - پشت دیوار شب
Mina's Secret - Raaze Mina - راز مینا
Story Line: Talented actress Mina gets more than she bargained for when she makes a promise to her friend, Asieh. Asieh and her family are being pursued by the Intelligence Agency in connection with a mysterious briefcase, and need a safe place to hide out. However, when Mina is late to their rendezvous, disaster strikes. Now Mina is saddled with Sahar, Asieh’s young daughter, and a case stuffed with dangerous information. Explosive action and chase sequences abound in this exciting, emotional thriller.

Name: The Changed Man - Marde Avazi - مرد عوضی
Story Line: The crazy and penniless chemist Khosro discovers a new, powerful washing powder for which he hopes to receive the Nobel Prize and become a rich man. In an attempt to sell his formula to Jam, the president of a local washing powder factory, Khosro had a fatal accident. Jam on the other hand faces bankruptcy and workers strikes. In his impotence, Jam suffers a heart attack and is taken to the same hospital as Khosro was. The hospital's neurosurgeon has a far-reaching idea about how to make use of Khosro's alive brain and Jam's alive body, which results in a hilarious and entertaining mess.

Name: Scorpion - Aghrab - عقرب
Story Line: Iran-Iraq war veteran Zulfighar Hosseini (Jamshid Hashempour) is once again forced to get his hands dirty. When his old friend is cowardly murdered in his hospital bed, it sparks a wave of anger inside him and he sets out on a blood-soaked, devil-may-care quest for vengeance. He will be forced to come face to face with one of the most brutal and hazardous drug kingpins in the world.

Name: Birth Of A Butterfly - Tavalode Yek Parvaneh - تولد یک پروانه
Story Line: 'Birth of a Butterfly' is made up of three short dramatic episodes shot in the mountains of North-Western Iran. In an area with a deep connection to the natural world, the characters in each of the parables have their faith tested by the challenges ahead of them. Two children struggle with the burden of responsibility as their father blames them for their mother's illness, an old man and a boy journey to a miraculous spring that is said to cure all ills, and a visiting teacher is hailed as a prophet after his advice yields beneficial results to a remote mountain community. These episodes interweave themes of faith, companionship and the survival spirit, and are directed with aplomb by Mojtaba Raei.

Name: Girls in Expectancy - Dokhtarane Entezar - دختران انتظار
Story Line: A medical student find himself in financial difficulty with nowhere to turn. Desperate and in debt, his last hope could be in the hands of a patient at his hospital. However, all does not go to plan and he finds himself harbouring feelings he had not anticipated. The emergence of a third party only makes his plight more difficult. Gripping drama starring Parsa Pirouzfar and Niki Karimi.

Name: Leila - لیلا
Story Line: Leila is a kind-hearted and loving woman whose marriage to Reza starts off happily. But when she learns that she is infertile, her life changes rapidly. Devastated by the news, Leila finds herself under growing pressure from Reza's mother to let him take a second wife to bear his children, and what follows is a profound psychological study of a woman swept away on a complex emotional journey. Led by two wonderful performances by Leila Hatami (Leila) and Jamileh Sheikhi as Reza’s manipulative mother, this is a powerful and thought-provoking drama that doesn’t disappoint.

Name: Autumn Alley - Koocheye Paeez - کوچه پاییز
Story Line: Sinai's 1997 docufiction 'Autumn Alley' follows a number of Iranian artists like avant-garde poet, painter and sculptor Jazeh Tabatabaei and Iranian actor Mehdi Ahmadi. The film addresses the question of art and creativity in Iran.

Name: Chigh - چیغ
Story Line:
A series of 49 documentary films by 31 filmmakers, Children of the Land of Iran provides a window into the traditions, rituals and people within the rich and diverse culture of Iran. 

Chigh is a fabric used by the Kurd nomads of Western Iran for covering tents, and woven from reeds and goat's fleece into beautifully textured patterns. This documentary is a visual reflection on the making of Chigh which resonates with a deep sense of history, tradition and spirituality. With a narrative of Gabriel and the six days of creation accompanying the visual story, the film portrays the deep significance Chigh has in the lives of the nomadic people and their way of life.

Name: A Journey to Chazabeh - Safar be Chazabeh - سفر به چزابه
Story Line: Experimental war film about two friends who travel back in time to the front lines of the Iran-Iraq War.

Name: Kakadu - کاکادو
Story Line: A professor teaching the language of earth inhabitants is exiled from the planet Kakadu to the earth for a week. Kakadu is a planet in which all the environmentalists live and those who pollute the environment will be exiled to the earth.
Actor: Elsa Firouz Azar ( السا فیروز آذر )
Ateneh Faghih Nasiri ( آتنه فقیه نصیری‎‎ )

Name: The Feast - Ziafat - ضیافت
Story Line: Seven friends promise to meet each other in the future. On the promised day all come except Ramin who is now a lawyer working for a company. He is in danger so sends his wife instead and has hides himself in some unknown place. One of his friends Ali who is now a police decides to help him.

Name: Indian Gift - Tohfeye Hend - تحفه هند
Story Line: Directed by Mohammad Reza Zehtabi, this screwball comedy follows the adventures of Hassan as he struggles to maintain gainful employment. From stealing dogs to transporting the bodies of the recently deceased, Hassan tries his best but chaos never fails to follow. When a business opportunity involving several tonnes of tea presents itself, Hassan thinks his problems are over. When the demand for tea rockets due to the Iran-Iraq war, Hassan must finally take charge of the situation or risk losing his chance with the woman he loves. Akbar Abdi plays the incorrigible clown to perfection in this hilarious caper.
Actor: Morteza Ahmadi ( مرتضی حاج سید احمدی )

Name: Born Loser - Pakbakhteh - پاکباخته
Story Line: 'Pakbakhteh' is a humorous look into the lives of two very different men who share one striking similarity: they have both been losers since birth. When bumbling policeman Abbas moves his family into a new home, he hopes that it will be a fresh start for him too. Unfortunately, on his first night at work he bumps into a petty criminal in the act of a robbery. Abbas gives chase and a hilarious game of cat-and-mouse ensues between the pair. Will this policeman, devoid of any luck, manage to get his man, or will this wacky criminal finally manage to outrun him?

Name: The Sultan - Soltan - سلطان
The Turtle - Lakposht - لاک پشت
At the School of Seyed Qelich Ishan - Dar Madrese Seyed Qelich Ishan - در مدرسه سید قلیچ ایشان
Story Line:
A series of 49 documentary films by 31 filmmakers, Children of the Land of Iran provides a window into the traditions, rituals and people within the rich and diverse culture of Iran. 

The film tells a very emotionally engaging story about a clergyman who decides to fulfil his military service in a medical institution. This institution, incidently, specializes in taking care of patients with an incurable disease. The film consists of beautifully constructed cinematography which reflects the atmosphere of the spiritual theme behind it.

Name: The Derrick - Dakal - دکل
Story Line: It is the middle of the Iran-Iraq War and Abadan is under siege. Hamid is a soldier who commands a group of Basijis, and he is determined to destroy a derrick which the Iraqis are using to attack the city. As Abadan is evacuated, and Hamid's family with it, the young commander soon finds battle lines drawn and friends caught up in the middle of it. When his best friend Amir proposes to his sister Zahra, who stayed behind to help defend the city with Hamid, he finds his loyalties torn between his mission and his hope for a brighter future. However, his obsession with the derrick may prove to be the undoing of everything.
Actor: Mohammad Ali Ahangar ( محمدعلی باشه آهنگر )

Name: Paper Airplanes - Moushake Kaghazi - موشک کاغذی
Story Line: A poetic piece of work that tells the story of a projectionist, Hashem Hakemzadeh, as he drives up to the countryside with his son Reza in order to show films to poor villagers living in remote areas far away from the city. An emotional and essential piece of Iranian cinema by director Farhad Mehranfar; a film about the importance of cinema and the effect it has on audiences. Winner of several film festivals, Paper Airplanes celebrates life and nature in a unique and spectacular manner.

Name: The Love Squadron  - Eskadrane Eshgh - اسکادران عشق
Story Line: Drama following the life of a rookie pilot, Farid, as he attempts to make a career in the Iranian air force while balancing a turbulent relationship with his wife and military father. After stealing a valuable statue in a daring robbery, Farid smuggles it with him to the country's border, but offloading it to the prospective buyers proves problematic. By turns a domestic drama, an adventure thriller and a war movie, 'The Love Squadron' has something for fans of every genre, with some excellently-choreographed flying scenes.

Name: Green Hell - Jahaname Sabz - جهنم سبز
Story Line: In this cautionary tale about poaching, elderly gamekeeper Heydari's encounter with a group of illegal hunters whilst on patrol ends in tragedy.
